briefdescription.para: longest file names allowed in input files
translate 0/1 to N/Y to write pull dimensions
Stop integrating autoccorelation function when ACF drops under this value.
Boolean XOR.
Number of elements in fnm (used for command line parsing)
enum for energy units
enum for type of input files (pdos, tpr, or pullf)
enum for bootstrapping method

detaileddescription.para:
These bootstrap methods are supported:
bootstrap complete histograms with continuous weights (Bayesian bootstrap) (bsMethod_BayesianHist)
bootstrap complete histograms (bsMethod_hist)
bootstrap trajectories from given umbrella histograms. This generates new "synthetic" histograms (bsMethod_traj)
bootstrap trajectories from Gaussian with mu/sigma computed from the respective histogram (bsMethod_trajGauss). This gives very similar results compared to bsMethod_traj.

FOR MORE DETAILS ON THE BOOTSTRAP METHODS (INCLUDING EXAMPLES), SEE JS Hub, BL de Groot, D van der Spoel g_wham - A free weighted histogram analysis implementation including robust error and autocorrelation estimates, J Chem Theory Comput, 6(12), 3713-3720 (2010)

briefdescription.para: Make an umbrella window (may contain several histograms)
Delete an umbrella window (may contain several histograms)
Read and setup tabulated umbrella potential.
Read the header of an PDO file (position, force const, nr of groups)

briefdescription.para: Read the data columns of and PDO file.

detaileddescription.para: TO DO: Get rid of the scanf function to avoid the clang warning. At the moment, this warning is avoided by hiding the format string the variable fmtlf.

briefdescription.para: Set identical weights for all histograms.

detaileddescription.para: Normally, the weight is given by the number data points in each histogram, together with the autocorrelation time. This can be overwritten by this routine (not recommended). Since we now support autocorrelations, it is better to set an appropriate autocorrelation times instead of using this function.

briefdescription.para: Simple linear interpolation between two given tabulated points.
Check which bins substiantially contribute (accelerates WHAM)

detaileddescription.para: Don't worry, that routine does not mean we compute the PMF in limited precision. After rapid convergence (using only substiantal contributions), we always switch to full precision.

detaileddescription.para: This is used when bootstapping new trajectories and thereby create new histogtrams, but it is not required if we bootstrap complete histograms.

briefdescription.para: Calculate cumulative distribution function of of all histograms.

detaileddescription.para: This allow to create random number sequences which are distributed according to the histograms. Required to generate the "synthetic" histograms for the Bootstrap method

briefdescription.para: Return j such that xx[j] <= x < xx[j+1].

detaileddescription.para: This is used to generate a random sequence distributed according to a histogram

briefdescription.para: read pullf-files.dat or pullx-files.dat and tpr-files.dat
Read integrated autocorrelation times from input file (option -iiact)

detaileddescription.para: Note: Here we consider tau[int] := int_0^inf ACF(t) as the integrated autocorrelation times. The factor g := 1 + 2*tau[int] subsequently enters the uncertainty.

briefdescription.para: Smooth autocorreltion times along the reaction coordinate.

detaileddescription.para: This is useful if the ACT is subject to high uncertainty in case if limited sampling. Note that -in case of limited sampling- the ACT may be severely underestimated. Note: the g=1+2tau are overwritten. If opt->bAllowReduceIact==FALSE, the ACTs are never reduced, only increased by the smoothing

memberdef.argsstring: (t_UmbrellaWindow *window, int nwins, t_UmbrellaOptions *opt, const char *fn, const char *xlabel)

briefdescription.para: Try to compute the autocorrelation time for each umbrealla window.
compute average and sigma of each umbrella histogram
Use histograms to compute average force on pull group.
Check if the complete reaction coordinate is covered by the histograms.
Compute initial potential by integrating the average force.

detaileddescription.para: This speeds up the convergence by roughly a factor of 2
